attributes.action: Government should acknowledge PPE shortages and act to ensure adequate supplies
attributes.additional_details: The Government is forcing doctors, nurses and care workers to place themselves and their patients in grave danger by expecting them to treat COVID-19 patients without adequate PPE. This is just after the Government said that supplies of PPE were plentiful, and that equipment was flowing out to trusts. No doctor, nurse or care worker should ever have to be in harm’s way when they go to work, and in these unprecedented times, this has never been more important.
attributes.background: Front line NHS staff and care workers need Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to do their job safely. The Government should apologise over the lack of supply of PPE. There should have better forward planning and its not right for Government to warn NHS staff against the overuse of PPE.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about PPE, but it's not clear what action you want the Government to take.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Provide all workers dealing with the public PPE to be protected from COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307866

Protect essential workers from contracting and spreading Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306387

Supply PPE to all Health and Social Care workers including community carers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314229

Provide adequate PPE equipment for medical professionals working with COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304243

Provide urgent support and PPE to carers during coronavirus crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312960

Suitable equipment to protect our front-line police officers from COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310079

Fund and provide safety clothing for the supermarket staff on the frontline: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305874

COVID-19: Commandeer production of British-made PPE for frontline staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312024

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
